title: Translating Ontologies in a Real-World Setting with ESSOT
segmentation: Good afternoon, my name is Milton honey and I'm at the search that folder located in Trento, Italy and today we present our work title translating ontologies in real world settings with asset that is a work done jointly with Miguel, a Konan pool, water from inside Centre in Galway.
So my AM today is not only to show you why the energy translation task is still important.

This system in to support the work of nor engineers and language experts that in real world context have to work a collaborative collaboratively for managing the whole ontology translation lifecycle.

I would start by giving a context to overpower worker.
Then I will discuss the steps that we accomplished for designing and implementing the full architecture.
And then I will conclude by presenting evaluation from both a quantitative and a qualitative perspective.
So the first question is why do we need to translate ontologies?
I don't think to have a final answer to this question, but I can show you a couple of reasons for which the energy transitions task is still important.

So as first example, let's consider knowledge engineers that have to model multi lingual ontology, but they are not able to describe concept by using labels that are different from their mother tongue.
So this scenario is more common than what you can expect, especially nowadays where a lot of ontologies are created anywhere in the world where describing the most disparate topics.
Then a branch of this scenario is the necessity of maintaining the different the alignments between different instance.
Different translations of the same ontologies, because these ontologies can be integrated integrated into end use applications and then use the for activities like tagging.

Then the second scenario concerns.
The situation which ontologies are created by using languages that are not accessible by many people.

First one is language language, barriers of the knowledge engineers.

As I mentioned in the previous slide, but another can be policy constraint and ontology can be created by using specific language due to the role of this ontology in a specific project or in a specific national context.
So in this way, if we want to disseminate the modern knowledge, we need to translate this ontology further languages.
